resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete the data?

Shielding method: Native + Java Hook

Shielding point: Class.classForName, BaseDexClassLoader.findClass method

Shielding rule: Keyword contains, case sensitive

note: Dynamically loaded classes can be blocked, direct references cannot be blocked temporarily

Shielding method: Native Java Hook

Shielding point: Throwable.nativeGetStackTrace

Shielding rule: Keyword contains, case sensitive

note: Only match the class name in the stack, if found, delete the element

Shielding method: Dynamic proxy

Shielding point: PackageManager related method

Shielding rule: Package name exactly matches

note: Directly hide PackageManager query results on the blacklist

Shielding method: Delete directly

Shielding point: System.getProperty method

Shielding rule: The property name exactly matches

note: Usually Java properties are not used, so delete the blacklist properties directly

Shielding method: Hook replace

Shielding point: System.getenv method

Shielding rule: The environment variable name matches exactly, and the variable value is replaced by a regular expression

note: Native intercept callback java processing

"Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: native system property method

Shielding rule: The properties name exactly matches, the property value is replaced 

note: Non-string type values will be converted to the corresponding type, you need to ensure that the string value is legal, otherwise it will cause native exception "

Shielding method: Dynamic proxy

Shielding point: ActivityManager, ActivityTaskManager some methods

Shielding rule: Keyword match

note: Prevent access to the current application service, process, task, component name containing keywords

Shielding method: Hook

Shielding point: Global.getString method

Shielding rule: Property name exactly matches the value of the replacement property

note: Some debugging or development attributes need to be corrected, such as adb_enabled to determine whether adb is enabled. Non-string types need to be converted to the corresponding type by themselves, otherwise it will not take effect

"Shielding method: Native Java Hook

Shielding point: UNIXProcess.forkAndExec(Android 7 above)/ProcessManager.exec method

Shielding rule: The command name matches exactly, the parameter can be replaced, the input/output/error flow is fixed

note: Native Hook is a more low-level method, intercepting commands and replacing parameters. At present, the stream is only fixed. The input stream is the named normal output result, and the output stream is to write commands to the process. Usually, the wrong stream is the result of a named execution error. "
The input class name is invalid
Command name,do not modify if empty
Command parameters, space separated parameters, \\\\ escape spaces
Regular expression replacement value, multiple regular line breaks

Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: fopen,open etc. method

Shielding rule: The file name matches exactly, the absolute path starts with ‘/’

note: Direct soft interrupt system calls cannot be intercepted

Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: dlsym function

Shielding rule: Symbol name matches exactly

note: Only use the dlsym method to dynamically obtain symbols to block, manual analysis such as maps files or soinfo cannot be blocked

Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: open etc. function

Shielding rule: Keyword match, delete line or replace keywords 

note: File redirection replacement
The data has changed, are you sure you want to exit?
Do you want to modify the data?

"Non-Edxposed on Android 9 and above may not be able to read the configuration file. The optional Root mode installation configuration file does not require additional permissions. If not, please enable the self-launching permission of this application. If some mobile phones enable the self-launching permission and still cannot read the configuration, it is recommended to change It turns on background retention to avoid being cleaned up. \nNote that for some simulators (such as Thunderbolt), the arm architecture is preferred when the application contains two architectures of arm and x86, so it will cause a crash. Just download the x86 version. For more introduction and feedback, please click the link below "

"Its Native Hook uses a similar ld_proload mode to dynamically set the Hook module as a preload library, so internally modify the data structure of the linker to manually add the module to the preload list. After the addition is successful, you need to relocate the key system library to import the symbolic address Point to the Hook module, and the import table of the module loaded after the Hook module takes effect will be redirected.
Of course there are corresponding disadvantages
 1. Not inline hook intercepts all calls.
 2. The system library loaded prematurely needs to be manually called the relocation library to be intercepted.
 3. The syscall function has been intercepted internally. If the soft interrupt is used to directly call the system, it cannot be intercepted. Of course, the inline Hook cannot be done.
 4. At present, the Native layer interception of java execvp is still unable to succeed. If modified, the normal exit status of the child process will not always be obtained. In fact, the child process has not exited. "
Intercepting Java execpe calls will cause all Runtime.exec to be executed unsuccessfully
Ignore Java execpe interception, unable to intercept Runtime.exec
Are you sure about soft restart?
Failed to create directory, unable to continue writing file: %1$s
The result of executing the command is incorrect: %1$s

Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: fopen, open etc. function

Shielding rule: File name/directory name exactly matches

note: Native redirects the old path to the new path, first judges the blacklist and then judges the path redirection, the directory only redirects the first-level directory, and the second-level directory needs to be added again

"Add file/directory redirection.\nDirectory can only be added to the first level, and the second level directory needs to be added again.\nDue to permission issues, it may not be able to correctly identify whether it is a file or a directory. You may need to manually check/cancel the directory option. If you cannot get the path when opening the file, you need to manually enter the path. "

"Shielding method: Native Hook

Shielding point: stat etc. function

Shielding rule: File name/directory name exactly matches

note: The priority is after the redirection path, so if the file is redirected, the new path after the redirection must be provided, and the gid, uid, and access permissions of the file must be changed. "
